title: Tesla Surpasses $1 Trillion in Market Value as Hertz Orders 100,000 Vehicles
summary: Hertz's major bulk purchase could help Tesla get more of its cars into the hands of mainstream consumers. Tesla Inc. crossed $1 trillion in market value Monday, joining a select group of companies after its stock price more than doubled this past year on surging vehicle sales and rising profits.

title: Dave Chappelle Addresses 'The Closer' Controversy During Stand-Up Show
summary: Comedian stands by comments, agrees to meet with transgender employees at Netflix and says he will self-distribute his new documentary. Comedian Dave Chappelle addressed the controversy over his Netflix Inc. special during a stand-up routine Sunday, adding that he would self-distribute his new documentary film in 10 cities.

title: Are There Enough Strawberries in a Kellogg's Strawberry Pop-Tart? A Court Might Decide
summary: Lawsuit asks for $5 million in relief, claiming the toaster pastries actually contain more pears and apples; 'non-strawberry fruit ingredients'. What's in a Pop-Tart? Not enough strawberries, according to lawsuits filed against Kellogg Co. , which makes the pantry staple.

title: Sky 'Rivers,' Bomb Cyclone Pummel California
summary: The Golden State gets pummeled with heavy rain, while Oregon and Washington see strong winds. Heavy rain and strong winds pounded parts of California and the Pacific Northwest over the weekend and into Monday, causing flooding, landslides, road closures and power outages.

title: Charlottesville Trial Aims to Show 'Unite the Right' Organizers Planned Violence
summary: Leaders of the white-supremacy movement say they were exercising protected free speech and didn't commit violence themselves. More than four years after a rally of white supremacists at the University of Virginia turned deadly, two dozen of the demonstrations' leaders and groups began trial in federal court in a lawsuit alleging they conspired to incite violence.

title: A Fake Story Joe Biden Can't Stop Telling
summary: Now he's swearing it's true.. At an appearance in New Jersey on Monday President Joe Biden spent about 10% of his speech telling a story that isn't true. It isn't the first time that Mr. Biden has spun this yarn but the tale seems to be getting taller with each telling. The story, which involves his travels on Amtrak, isn't necessarily of great national consequence, except perhaps as a window into his character or competence. His recent commentary on more significant subjects also raises questions about his veracity and acuity.

title: Facebook Goes Fishing for Likes From Wall Street
summary: The social-media company's share slump makes it look like decent value, at least by comparison. Social media is far from perfect, but it is a game-for better or for worse-that is won by comparison.

title: Comscore Names New CFO as It Looks to Boost Revenue
summary: Jon Carpenter is set to join the company from privately held Publishers Clearing House next month. Media-measurement firm Comscore Inc. tapped an industry executive as its new finance chief as the company works to boost revenue and enhance its existing tools for quantifying the audience of video-streaming content.

title: The Democrats' Wealth-Tax Mirage
summary: Their last fiscal resort is taxing unrealized capital gains of 'billionaires.'. Democrats are scrambling to finance their spending bill after Arizona Sen. Kyrsten Sinema shot down their plans to raise corporate and individual income-tax rates. Thank you, Senator. But now Democrats are reaching deep into their grab-bag of revenue tricks and may pull out a wealth tax on "billionaires."

title: How a Bomb Cyclone and Atmospheric River Combined to Batter California, West Coast
summary: Resume Subscription. Storms pounded California over the weekend, ending the state's driest 12-month period since 1924. While weather extremes aren't uncommon in California, the past days' rainfall has exceeded expectations as a large, fast-forming, wind storm known as a "bomb cyclone" converged with a flow of rain and moisture known as an "atmospheric river."

title: U.S. Treasury Creates New Post Focused on Racial Equity
summary: Secretary Janet Yellen says appointment would help department address pre-pandemic economic inequalities. WASHINGTON-The Treasury Department said Monday it had created a new position to support the Biden administration's efforts to promote economic opportunities for communities of color as the nation recovers from the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Biden's New Jersey Election Jitters
summary: As the Governor's race tightens, the President makes an appearance.. President Biden has plenty to do as congressional Democrats struggle to pass the tax increases and entitlement expansions that are the core of his agenda. So it's notable that for much of Monday Mr. Biden was not in Washington but New Jersey with Democratic Gov. Phil Murphy, who is up for re-election next week.

title: Blinken Seems Intent on Sparking a Crisis Over Jerusalem
summary: The State Department wants to open a consulate to the Palestinians there despite Israel's objections.. The biggest diplomatic spat between Israel and the U.S. in recent memory is brewing over the Biden administration's insistence on opening a consulate to conduct diplomatic relations with the Palestinian Authority and locating it in Israel's capital, Jerusalem. Despite vociferous Israeli protest, the State Department has repeatedly said it would push forward with opening a consulate anyway, and Secretary Antony Blinken will personally lead the effort.

title: Bicyclists Usurp New York's Sidewalks
summary: Elderly members of my synagogue worry a walk to the grocery store might land them in the emergency room.. New York

title: State Department to Form New Cyber Office to Face Proliferating Global Challenges
summary: Changes are part of Biden administration's treatment of cybersecurity as a critical national security issue. WASHINGTON-The State Department plans organizational changes to confront international cybersecurity challenges such as ransomware and waning global digital freedom, U.S. officials said, the latest overhaul by the Biden administration aimed at treating cyber threats as a top-tier national-security issue.

title: Turrialba Makes, the World Series Takes
summary: The small Costa Rica town houses the only factory for major-league baseballs.. Washington

title: 'Watching Darkness Fall' Review: Our Men in Europe
summary: As fascism rose in the 1930s, it was reviled, embraced or misunderstood by U.S. ambassadors in Berlin, Moscow, London, Paris and Rome.. As we look back on the 1930s and the conflicts that proved to be a prelude to war, it is natural to focus on the decisions of national leaders. But diplomatic relations took place at a less exalted level, too-in far-flung consulates and embassies. David McKean, an ambassador to Luxembourg in the final year of the Obama administration, had the good idea of tracking America's response to Germany's rise by describing the milieu of America's ambassadors and by assessing the policies they pursued and the actions they took. In "Watching Darkness Fall," he tells the story largely through the eyes of the men who represented the U.S. in London, Moscow, Berlin, Paris and Rome during the pivotal early years of Franklin Roosevelt's administration.

title: In Europe, Confusion Reigns About the U.S.
summary: America's pivot to Asia has stirred the most significant misunderstanding.. Paris

title: Facebook Posts Slower Sales Growth With Apple Privacy Policy
summary: Social-media giant to change reporting structure, breaking out unit that includes AR and VR products and services. Facebook Inc. blamed Apple Inc.'s privacy rules for posting slower sales growth and warned of further uncertainty for the social-media giant's crucial advertising business.

title: Who's Afraid of Donald Trump?
summary: In Virginia, Terry McAuliffe backs claim of a stolen election-for Stacey Abrams.. For a man whose campaign for Virginia governor is based on painting his Republican opponent as "Donald Trump in khakis," Terry McAuliffe is now sounding pretty Trumpy himself.

title: Notable & Quotable: Leonard Leo on Constitutional Originalism
summary: 'We seek a society that upholds human dignity and individual freedom.'. The Federalist Society's Leonard Leospeaking Oct. 21 to the National Review Institute:

title: Democrats Negotiate Tax, Healthcare Provisions as Biden Seeks Deal This Week
summary: Party seeks legislative framework before Glasgow climate summit and to win support for separate infrastructure package. WASHINGTON-Democrats are sprinting to wrap up negotiations over their social-spending and climate bill, hoping by this weekend to resolve disagreements on issues including tax policy and healthcare.

title: Afghan Refugees Can Be Sponsored by Private Citizens Under New Program
summary: State Department will screen applicants as huge backlog overwhelms resettlement agencies. WASHINGTON-Private citizens will be allowed to sponsor Afghan families under a new program launched Monday by the Biden administration, as overwhelmed agencies have left thousands stuck on military bases in harsh conditions waiting to be resettled.

title: Judges Would Face Tougher Stock-Trading Rules Under Bipartisan Bill
summary: House hearings set; planned actions follow Wall Street Journal reports on financial conflicts in the judiciary. Federal judges would be required to report stock trades over $1,000 within 45 days and post their financial-disclosure forms online under legislation proposed by a bipartisan group of lawmakers in the Senate and House of Representatives.

title: Judge Declines to Pause Talc Litigation Against Johnson & Johnson
summary: But LTL Management, a J&J subsidiary, will get another chance to stop litigation against its parent company in early November. A bankruptcy judge refused an initial bid to pause talc litigation against Johnson & Johnson , setting the stage for a November hearing that will likely scrutinize the corporate maneuvering the company undertook to try to settle thousands of personal-injury lawsuits through a subsidiary's chapter 11.

title: S&P, Dow Rise to Fresh Record Highs
summary: Tesla topped $1 trillion in market cap for the first time. U.S. stocks marched upward Monday, with the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average closing at record highs.

title: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin Pursues Private Space Station
summary: The venture follows plans for new, company-operated outposts from Nanoracks, Axiom Space. Jeff Bezos' space company said it would help to build a new space station, part of a growing bet by entrepreneurs and companies that many future orbital facilities will be privately owned and operated.

title: Mastercard Partners With Bakkt to Bring Cryptocurrency Payments to the Masses
summary: Banks will be able to issue debit or credit cards that let people pay with bitcoin and earn cryptocurrency as rewards. Mastercard Inc. and crypto firm Bakkt Holdings Inc. on Monday said they have partnered to enable cryptocurrency card payments.

title: PayPal Abandons Pinterest Takeover After Its Shareholders Balk
summary: Media last week reported the two California-based companies were in early-stage talks for deal. PayPal Holdings Inc. backed off a potential $40-billion-plus takeover of Pinterest Inc. after the payments company's shareholders balked.

title: Equitable Chairman Departs Over Communications That Didn't Meet Standards
summary: The financial firm and its fund unit say they won't comment further on Ramon de Oliveira's resignation. Equitable Holdings Inc. and its AllianceBernstein Holding LP said Ramon de Oliveira had resigned as independent chairman of both companies after engaging "in communications that were inconsistent with" their standards.

title: Youth-Focused Digital Platform FaZe Clan Inks $1 Billion SPAC Deal
summary: Backed by the singer Pitbull and other entertainment and sports celebrities, FaZe Clan targets Gen Z and millennial consumers. Youth-focused online platform FaZe Clan Inc. is combining with a special-purpose acquisition company to go public with a roughly $1 billion valuation, the companies said.

title: 'I Don't Live Here Anymore' by the War on Drugs Review: A Rock Group Breaks Loose
summary: Tinged with hope, the band's new album is about change and acceptance, and might be its best record yet..

title: Cryptocurrency Company Snared in SEC Dragnet Sues Regulator
summary: Terraform Labs says federal subpoenas embarrassed firm, broke agency rules. A cryptocurrency developer who was handed two subpoenas as he walked inside a hotel last month won't comply with the demands-and is instead suing the federal regulator that issued them.

title: Fly-by-Night (Tuesday Crossword, October 26)
El Chapo Lawyer Seeks New Trial Over Alleged Jury Misconduct
summary: A Vice news article quoted an anonymous juror who said many jurors followed the news during the trial and then lied to the judge about it. A lawyer for Mexican drug lord Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán Loera asked a federal appeals court in Manhattan on Monday to grant him a new trial, saying a media report of alleged juror misconduct was reason to overturn his conviction for running a narcotics empire.

title: Sudan Coup Draws Thousands to the Streets in Protest
summary: Tensions between the country's civilian and military leaders have been escalating amid a spiraling economic crisis. Thousands of Sudanese pro-democracy protesters streamed into the streets of the capital on Monday to reject a military coup of the transitional government that has ruled the country since the ouster of longtime dictator Omar al-Bashir.

title: Former Victoria's Secret CEO Lists New York City Penthouse for $18.5 Million
summary: Sharen Jester Turney, who was also an executive at Neiman Marcus, is moving to Texas.. Sharen Jester Turney, a former president and CEO of Victoria's Secret, and her husband, Charles Turney, are listing their New York City penthouse for $18.5 million.

title: A Flatiron Penthouse
summary: Sharen Jester Turney, a former president and CEO of Victoria's Secret, is listing her Manhattan home for $18.5 million.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Russian Military Drills Near Afghan Border Deliver Warning to Extremists
summary: Moscow and Russia's Central Asian neighbors signal an intention to prevent terrorism, ethnic tensions from spilling into their backyard. HARB-MAIDON RANGE, Tajikistan-Russia held a series of joint military exercises with its Central Asian neighbors near the border with Afghanistan last week, a reflection of the concern in Moscow that ethnic tension or terrorism could spill over from the country as extremists such as Islamic State challenge the Taliban's rule there.

title: U.S. to Exempt Certain Foreign Air Travelers From Vaccine Rules
summary: Children, people from countries with low vaccine supplies to be exempt from vaccination requirements, Biden administration says. Children and those from countries with low supplies of Covid-19 vaccines will be exempt from new requirements that foreign nationals show proof of vaccination to fly to the U.S., the Biden administration said Monday.

title: Rich Nations Lag Behind in Meeting Climate Fund Pledge
summary: A report for U.N. climate summit in Glasgow projects that wealthy nations won't hit finance pledge for developing nations until 2023. Wealthy governments won't fulfill a pledge to provide $100 billion a year to help developing countries fight climate change until at least 2023, according to a new report from climate negotiators, a setback that comes just days before a closely watched United Nations climate summit starts in Scotland.

title: The Easiest Way to Look Put-Together: Dress in One Color Head-to-Toe
summary: Single-hue outfits in shades like pink, emerald and subdued sandy beige are populating runways and city sidewalks alike. How to skillfully (and un-creepily) assemble a monochrome look.. MANY MEN FEAR colorful clothes. They'll sprinkle in the rare cayenne sweater or canary button-up but mainly stick to safe tans and pale grays. Joshua Safran is not one of these men.

title: The Democrats' Tax Plan Would Sink Real Estate
summary: We've seen it before. The 1986 reform led to the savings-and-loan crisis and the 1990-91 recession.. The most lasting effects of government policies are often the unintended consequences. Americans learned this lesson the hard way in the aftermath of the 1986 Tax Reform Act. The tax proposals in the Democrats' $3.5 trillion budget-reconciliation bill have the potential to kick off economy-crippling events similar to the savings-and-loan crisis of the late 1980s.

title: The GOP Has a Chance at More Than Election Victory
summary: It could break America's political stalemate by looking forward not back to Trump or Reagan.. 'The Arabs never miss an opportunity to miss an opportunity," the Israeli diplomat Abba Eban observed in 1973. As the unfolding Biden fiasco looks set to present Republicans with an unusually promising political moment, will the same prove true of America's conservative movement?

title: Facebook Whistleblower Calls for New Tech Laws in Europe
summary: Ex-staffer tells lawmakers that social-media platforms should have to disclose actions to combat misinformation and hate speech. LONDON- Facebook Inc. whistleblower Frances Haugen encouraged U.K. lawmakers to pass legislation to rein in social-media platforms, saying that Facebook has trouble curbing misinformation and hate speech in many languages and dialects, including British English.

title: Former ESPN Reporter Who Left Over Vaccine Mandate Joins the Daily Wire
summary: Williams to host series billed as 'sports without the woke' that will be available to conservative site's subscribers. Former ESPN reporter Allison Williams, who recently left the network after refusing to follow its Covid-19 vaccine mandate, has joined conservative site the Daily Wire.

title: Google Built a Camera to Better Portray People With Darker Skin Tones. Does It?
summary: The new Pixel 6 and Pixel 6 Pro claim to have the 'world's most inclusive camera.' Here's how it stacks up against Samsung's Galaxy S21 and Apple's iPhone 13 Mini. Google's artificial intelligence and machine-learning algorithms have in the past been criticized for how they deal with darker skin tones, including mistakenly tagging photos of Black people as gorillas. The company apologized and said it would fix its software. Now, it's using AI to power what it calls "the world's most inclusive camera."

title: AmEx Gets Younger, More Blue Collar
summary: American Express reported jumps in spending among Gen Z and millennial consumers and small businesses, helping it defy the recent doubts about cards. What do plumbers and Gen Zers have in common? Both are spending money right now.

title: Co-Head of Blackstone Hedge-Fund Business to Leave
summary: With John McCormick stepping down, Joseph Dowling to be sole head of Blackstone Alternative Asset Management. The co-head of Blackstone Inc.'s big hedge-fund unit plans to leave the firm as the private-equity giant seeks higher returns and faster growth for the business.

title: HSBC to Buy Back $2 Billion in Stock as Profit Jumps
summary: Profit rises as bank releases funds it had set aside for potential pandemic-related loan losses. HSBC Holdings PLC announced a $2 billion stock buyback and a surge in third-quarter net profit as the lender navigated rising geopolitical and property-market risks in China.

title: First Yazidi Genocide Trial Ends In Conviction of German Woman
summary: Court in Munich gives woman 10 year sentence for crimes against humanity in abuse and death of girl. BERLIN-The first trial related to Islamic State genocide against the Yazidi people ended in a conviction as a German court on Monday sentenced a member of the terror group to 10 years in prison for her role in the enslavement and killing of a 5-year-old girl.

title: Beijing Olympics Will Require Vaccine or 21-Day Quarantine
summary: The Winter Games will be held in a closed loop, organizers say, strictly limiting participants' movement, with daily testing and mask requirements also in place. Beijing 2022 organizers unveiled a tough set of Covid-19 protocols for next February's Winter Olympic Games, including a requirement that almost all participants be vaccinated against the virus or face a 21-day quarantine that would effectively shred their competitive hopes.

title: What Taiwan Deserves and Beijing Precludes
summary: Recognition of Taiwanese independence might well be viewed as a casus belli by the Chinese.. Regarding John Bolton's op-ed "It'll Take More Than American Military Might to Shore Up Taiwan" (Oct. 21): The world has changed in the past 30 years and the Covid pandemic is the last straw. Countries around the world-not only in the Indo-Pacific but also Canada, Britain, Lithuania and Poland, as well as the U.S.-are altering their previous and more politic economic-focused view of China's "wolf-warrior diplomacy."

title: India Bets Big on Free-Market Reform
summary: Privatizing Air India is only the latest step.. Regarding "New Delhi Says Tata to Nationalization" (Sadanand Dhume, East Is East, Oct. 14): Under Prime Minister Narendra Modi, India is embarking on the most transformative supply-side, free-market reforms in a generation. The Modi government is not only privatizing state-owned enterprises but also overhauling taxes, relaxing foreign direct investment (FDI) rules and deregulating labor and agriculture markets.

title: Universities' Gain Is Students' Loss in College-Loan Racket
summary: University presidents apparently took Lending 101 from subprime-mortgage bankers.. Colleges are in a great position: They can sell their product at the price they want knowing that students will take out loans to pay for it ("Student-Debt Crisis Ensnares Parents," Page One, Oct. 14).

title: Biden Has Been Wrong on Oil and Gas for Decades
summary: He voted against the Trans-Alaska Pipeline in 1973.. Your editorial "Biden Suddenly Loves Frackers" (Oct. 16) brings to mind the list of things the president has been wrong about over his long career in Washington. Rarely is it mentioned during the recitation of that list that then-Sen. Biden voted against the Trans-Alaska Pipeline in 1973, when most people were learning the initials "OPEC." He was one of five senators to cast such a vote.

title: Resist San Francisco's Redefinition of Shoplifting
summary: High-value thievery is called larceny in New York.. The headline to Jason Riley's column "San Francisco Has Become a Shoplifter's Paradise" (Upward Mobility, Oct. 20) inadvertently illustrates a problem that is becoming pervasive in America. Democrats change the generally accepted and common usage of a word or phrase, and then the media adopts the new definition in its reporting.

title: New Apple AirPods Review: Great Sound, if They Stay in Your Ears
summary: The third-generation AirPods feature better sound, battery life and water resistance, but have a different shape that might not fit your ears. I was leaning over the sink, washing my face, when one of the new third-generation AirPods had a brush with death. The right earbud popped out and bounced, then bounced again, before landing inches from the wide-open drain.

title: Inflation Pinches Restaurants, but Customers Seem Willing to Split the Check
summary: Casual-dining stocks such as Brinker International are logging a major hit to profits from food and labor costs but should be able to pass more of it through in the future. Inflation is making casual-dining shareholders sick to their stomachs. Relief is likely on the way.

title: CVS Health Launches $25 Million Ad Campaign Focused on 'Healthy'
summary: The campaign is meant to drive awareness of the company's role in peoples' lives as they take steps toward being healthier and use more digital tools to do so. CVS Health Corp. is introducing its first major ad campaign aiming to show the breadth of its health services and the role that the company played during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Evergrande Doesn't Cloud HSBC's Sunny Forecast
summary: Buyback shows bank's confidence that it will capture Asian growth and be insulated from any Evergrande default and wider real-estate fallout. HBSC's pivot to Asia remains promising despite China's slowing growth and real-estate market uncertainty.

title: Biden Administration Aims to Boost Covid-19 Rapid Test Supply
summary: Officials want to back new manufacturers to meet higher testing demand. Federal officials said they would do more to get over-the-counter Covid-19 tests to consumers, after some manufacturers have struggled to meet demand after the Delta surge drove increased demand from individuals, schools and businesses.

title: Amnesty International Exits Hong Kong, Citing National Security Law
summary: Human-rights group says authorities' crackdown on dissent makes maintaining operations in city unworkable. HONG KONG-Amnesty International said it would pull out of Hong Kong by the end of the year, marking one of the most prominent departures of a civil-rights group since China's imposition of a sweeping new security law on the city.

title: This World Series Features the Oldest Managerial Matchup Ever
summary: Unusual circumstances have placed Dusty Baker, 72, and Brian Snitker, 66, at the helm of the Houston Astros and Atlanta Braves as they compete for a championship. Major League Baseball has largely dismissed dinosaurs like Dusty Baker and Brian Snitker as viable managerial candidates, casting them aside as relics from a previous era no longer capable of understanding the modern game. Teams today prefer young, recently retired players who have a background in analytics and a willingness to cede decision-making authority to the front office and its all-knowing spreadsheets.

title: Volvo IPO Prices Lower Than Expected Despite Ambitious EV Plans
summary: Pricing shows old auto is no match for valuations enjoyed by Tesla and other pure electric-vehicle players. Volvo Cars, the Swedish auto maker owned by China's Zhejiang Geely Holding Group, on Monday set the price for its initial public offering at the low end of its target range, highlighting investors' unwillingness to lend traditional car makers the valuations enjoyed by younger electric-vehicle companies.

title: Pinterest, Bakkt, Tesla, Facebook: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today
summary: Pinterest shares slumped after PayPal said it isn't pursuing a deal for the social-media company. Wall Street indexes opened higher to start a busy week of earnings from big technology companies. Here's what we're watching in Monday's trading:

title: Trump's Look Backward Poses Peril for GOP
summary: Focus on 2020 election grievance rather than themes worrying voters risks losing crucial independents and moderate Democrats. It is an article of faith in political life that election campaigns-as least the successful ones-are about the future, not about the past.

title: CommScope Names Kyle Lorentzen as CFO
summary: Lorentzen to become finance chief of network connectivity company effective Nov. 1. CommScope Holding Company Inc. said it named Kyle Lorentzen, currently senior vice president and chief transformation officer, as executive vice president and chief financial officer effective Nov. 1.

title: Kim Kardashian West's Skims to Partner With Fendi
summary: The star's shapewear company is launching a line with the Italian brand.. Fendi, the 96-year-old Roman luxury fashion house owned by LVMH, will collaborate with Kim Kardashian West to launch a women's collection, the companies said Monday.

title: New York City Inches Toward Covid-19 Becoming Endemic
summary: High rates of vaccination and some prior infection have bolstered protection, epidemiologists say, helping the city transition toward treating the coronavirus as chronic. Each wave of Covid-19 patients that has crashed through the doors of Long Island Jewish Medical Center in Queens has been more manageable than the last.

title: Kim Kardashian West on What Comes Next
summary: Resume Subscription. Secretly, for 10 hours in Cabo San Lucas, Mexico, this past March, Kim Kardashian West and her Skims team met with fashion designer Kim Jones and his team from the Italian label Fendi for a marathon fitting session. At the time, most Europeans were blocked from entering the U.S. due to pandemic controls, but it was essential that they meet in person. Kardashian West is the fit model for a just-released collaboration between Fendi and Skims, an undergarments and apparel label she launched in 2019.

title: Night of the NFL Panic Zombies
summary: Booooooooo! Our ghoulish columnist is here to declare the undead and ready-to-rise in the 2021 football season.. Halloween's almost here, so in the interest of some lighthearted newspaper fun wrapped in a hacky holiday theme, it's time to prematurely declare some NFL Zombie Teams-teams that aren't officially dead, or even close mathematically eliminated, but, you know...pretty much are.

title: Katie Couric on Matt Lauer, Her Media Diet and Writing Her New Memoir
summary: "It was important for me to shine a lens on myself and to be introspective about my own mistakes," says Couric of her provocative memoir, "Going There.". Katie Couric isn't proud of several moments in her journalism career, like when she went "undercover" as a homeless person for a bit of stunt reporting, or the time on her Yahoo show she edited out Ruth Bader Ginsburg's disapproving statements on athletes who kneel during the national anthem in order to "protect" her. "It was important for me to shine a lens on myself and to be introspective about my own mistakes in my own personal evolution," Couric, 64, now says.

title: Natural-Gas Sticker Shock Is Coming to Your Dinner Table and Commute
summary: Expensive natural gas is having all sorts of cascading effects, some of which may only show up next year. High natural-gas prices today mean your electricity and heating bills will likely be expensive this winter. Next year, it could mean you will end up paying more to eat and to fill up your car.

title: Young People Say Disconnect Keeps Them From Church
summary: Half of people between 13 and 25 surveyed by a nonprofit said they felt out of sync with their houses of worship on race, gender, immigration and more. Several religious denominations have seen memberships fall in recent years, including among young adults and teens. A new survey suggests that many young people perceive a disconnect between themselves and the houses of worship that need believers to sustain their congregations.

title: Australia Considers New Privacy Rules to Protect Children on Social Media
summary: Proposed regulations could make it illegal for social-media platforms such as Facebook to direct children to harmful content. SYDNEY-Australia is considering new data-privacy rules that could make it illegal for social-media companies to direct children to harmful content, the latest move by lawmakers around the world to address concerns about the impact of online platforms on young people's mental health.

title: China Evergrande Says Work on Some Residential Projects Has Resumed
summary: Developer posted photographs showing workers on the job in cities including Shenzhen, Dongguan and Zhongshan. China Evergrande Group said construction is progressing at some of its residential projects in southern China, as the highly indebted developer tries to stave off collapse and deliver the homes it has promised to more than a million people.

title: House Republicans Call for Tougher Controls to Keep U.S. Tech From China
summary: In a letter to Commerce Secretary Raimondo, the GOP lawmakers urge action to protect semiconductors, aviation and emerging technologies. WASHINGTON-Republican China hawks in Congress are pressuring the Commerce Department to fortify export controls to keep critical American technology from falling into Beijing's hands.

title: Mark Cuban-Owned Company Launches Pharmacy-Benefit Manager
summary: An employer group is also starting a company to manage prescription-drug benefits as frustration mounts with the PBMs hired to control spending. A pair of new companies are being launched to tackle high drug costs, the latest sign of employer frustration with the middlemen, known as PBMs, whose job it is to keep down the spending.

title: Tesla Supplier Shows Off More Powerful Battery
summary: Panasonic looks to sell new product to U.S. EV maker. TOKYO- Tesla Inc. supplier Panasonic Corp. said it has mostly solved the technology challenges with a larger lithium-ion battery that Elon Musk has called the lowest-cost way to power an electric car.

title: Buyout Firms Set Record for Debt-Fueled Payouts
summary: Private-equity firms have borrowed over $58 billion this year for dividend recapitalizations, loans that fatten managers' wallets but saddle portfolio companies with debt. Private-equity firms are taking advantage of a frothy credit market to pay themselves record sums with borrowed money, a controversial practice that critics say benefits buyout-firm executives but can harm portfolio companies.

title: Supply-Chain Disruptions Encourage Rio Tinto to Mine U.S. Sludge for Critical Minerals
summary: Mining company aims to recover key materials including rhenium at its Kennecott copper mine in the U.S.. Snarled supply chains are giving new impetus to Rio Tinto PLC's efforts to produce minerals essential for modern technologies, starting with mining sludge from a giant copper pit in Western U.S.

title: CFOs Plump Salaries, Perks to Land Elusive New Employees
summary: Amid the 'Great Resignation,' companies have to offer compensation that stands out in order to draw new workers-and hold on to the ones they have. Finance chiefs are boosting salaries and recruitment spending, offering more in the way of perks and expanding their equity plans as they joust to attract-and retain-workers.

title: U.S. Covid-19 Battle Turns a Corner as Borders Open to Foreign Travelers
summary: Crowded planes, eased mask mandates in San Francisco and jammed pumpkin patches. When U.S. borders open to foreign travelers on Nov. 8, the country will have lifted one of the longest-standing restrictions imposed 19 months ago at the start of the pandemic, signaling a new phase of guarded optimism in the nation's battle with Covid-19.

title: Shoppers Find Discounts Are in Short Supply This Holiday Season
summary: Retailers say fewer markdowns are product of bottlenecks, inflation and their own efforts to rein in deals. One side effect of the Covid-19 pandemic heading into the holidays: fewer bargains for shoppers.

title: Fed Prepares to Taper Stimulus Amid More Doubts on Inflation
summary: Broadening price pressures could test Chairman Jerome Powell's 'transitory' hypothesis. Federal Reserve officials are set to wind down their $120 billion-a-month bond-purchase program in November, but questions over how soon inflation pressures will fade are creating more uneasiness inside the central bank.

title: Prepare for Propane Sticker Shock
summary: Exports have drained domestic supply ahead of heating season and prices have surged. Propane prices haven't been so high heading into winter in a decade, which is bad news for the millions of rural Americans who rely on the fuel to stay warm.

title: Sibanye-Stillwater Nears $1 Billion Deal to Acquire Brazilian Mines
summary: Global miners are racing to secure stocks of key metals used in electric-car batteries. Sibanye-Stillwater Ltd. is in advanced talks to buy two Brazilian mining companies for about $1 billion including debt, a bet on continued demand for metals used in the production of electric-car batteries.

title: SolarWinds Hackers Step Up Attacks on Tech Companies
summary: Russia-linked group has stepped up attacks, cybersecurity experts say. The Russia-linked hackers behind last year's compromise of a wide swath of the U.S. government and scores of private companies, including SolarWinds Corp. , have stepped up their attacks in recent months, breaking into technology companies in an effort to steal sensitive information, cybersecurity experts said.

title: Australia Backs $1.6 Billion Buy of Pacific Mobile Networks
summary: Deal is latest effort to own telecommunications infrastructure in region where China is seeking influence. SYDNEY-Australia is backing the purchase of mobile networks in six Pacific countries, a move that foreign-policy experts say is designed to block a military rival from buying the strategically important assets.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Up in the Air (Monday Crossword, October 26)
